means: 令人泄气的，使人气馁的
（使）漏气( deflate的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_cn: 当她拒绝时我感到灰心丧气。

sentence.Network_en: All the criticism had left her feeling totally deflated.

entry.tran: 使泄气;挫…的锐气;贬低…的重要性
entry.def: If you deflate someone or something, you take away their confidence or make them seem less important.

example.ex: Like any actor he can be self-centred but I think I've worked out how to deflate him...
example.tran: 跟其他演员一样，他有时也会以自我为中心，但我想自己已经找到了如何挫他锐气的办法。

example.ex: Britain's other hopes of medals were deflated earlier in the day.
example.tran: 英国另外的夺牌希望在那天早些时候受到了打击。

entry.tran: 放(轮胎、气球等)的气;（使）瘪掉
entry.def: When something such as a tyre or balloon deflates, or when you deflate it, all the air comes out of it.

example.ex: When it returns to shore, the life-jacket will deflate and revert to a harness...
example.tran: 返回岸上后，救生衣就会瘪掉，恢复成背带状。

means.word_mean: 2. collapsed through the release of gas or air

means.word_mean: 令人泄气的；使人气馁的

sentences.en: He was deflated by the news.
I was quite deflated by her lack of interest in my suggestions.
sentences.cn: 他对我的建议兴趣不大,令我感到十分气馁。
